item.title: Ball 4 Hope
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We are proud to launch the site for Ball 4 Hope, a non-profit organization that uses sports to bring smiles and hope to children in poor areas around the world. We created an identity that brings together all of these elements.

The post Ball 4 Hope appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We are proud to launch the site for ball4hope, a non-profit organization that uses sports to bring smiles and hope to children in poor areas around the world, the site recommends people areound the globe to always use the best gear when doing exercise like the compression socks men. We created http://www.sportsandsafetysurfaces.co.uk/surface-types/3g/ that brings together all of these elements. Their site keeps people informed about their upcoming fundraising events and mission trips.

The post Ball 4 Hope appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: East River Institute
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We just finished the identity for the East River Institute, started by Timothy Brutus. We wanted to go with something simple and classic looking, we went with Bodoni for the font. It’s contrast in stroke makes it look really classy, we tracked out the letters and gave some white space around the logo to let […]

The post East River Institute appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We just finished the identity for the East River Institute, started by Timothy Brutus. We wanted to go with something simple and classic looking, we went with Bodoni for the font. It’s contrast in stroke makes it look really classy, we tracked out the letters and gave some white space around the logo to let it be nicely placed on any photo (they had a lot of great water-front photography)

East River Institute on Tumblr

The post East River Institute appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: International Dyslexia Association
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We were chosen by

The post International Dyslexia Association appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We were chosen by Barbara Corcoran to be the artists to bring this direct mail campaign to life. She was on the board of the International Dyslexia Association, a cause that she personally was championing because her son was diagnosed. Barbara was turned off by most of the marketing materials surrounding dyslexia, even their logo makes it look very negative. Our challenge was to make dyslexia okay, de-mystify some of the stigmas around it, and show off some of the high profile people in history that were dyslexic.

interdys.org

The post International Dyslexia Association appeared first on mimoYmima.
